name: bitbased-source-tracker
description: Track code changes against any git reference or snapshots (not just the current branch) with visual indicators that work alongside built-in git features
author: Brant Wedel (https://bitbased.net)

sti-tracking-options-alt.description: Source Tracker tracking options alt icon

sti-tracking-base-alt.description: Source Tracker tracking base alt icon

sti-snapshot-options-alt.description: Source Tracker snapshot options alt icon

sourceTracker.display.diffDecorations.title: Change Tracking Decorations
sourceTracker.display.diffDecorations.markdownDescription: Configure which methods to use for displaying tracked change decorations

gutter.description: Show markers in the gutter for added, modified, and removed lines

overview.description: Show markers in the scrollbar/overview ruler

border.description: Add colored borders on changed lines

background.description: Highlight added lines with background color

backgroundModified.description: Highlight modified lines with background color

treeBadges.description: Show badges (a/m) in file explorer for added/modified files

treeColor.description: Color the badges in file explorer based on file status

sourceTracker.display.diffDecorationsGut.description: Controls the width(px) of diff decorations in gutter (added & modified).

enumDescriptions: Show Git Tracking menu by default
Show Snapshot Tracking menu by default
Automatically switch between Git and Snapshot tracking menus
sourceTracker.display.defaultEditorMenu.description: Default menu to show for the editor icon (Git Tracking, Snapshot Tracking, or Auto)

sourceTracker.display.customRefs.markdownDescription: List of custom branches, hashes, or other git refs to display in menus. Format: `<ref> <description>` where the description follows a space after the ref (e.g., `develop My develop branch`). Use pipe character (`|`) for fallbacks, (e.g., `master|main Main branch`) to try alternatives if first ref doesn't exist.
sourceTracker.display.customRefs.description: List of branches, hashes, or other git refs to display in menus

sourceTracker.display.recentBranches.description: Number of branches to display in menus

sourceTracker.display.recentCommits.description: Number of commits to display in menus

sourceTracker.display.recentSnapshots.description: Number of snapshots to display in menus

sourceTracker.display.commitTemplate.markdownDescription:
Template for commit display in menus. **Supported variables:**

- `${hash}`: Commit hash
- `${hashShort}`: Short commit hash
- `${subject}`: First line of the commit message
- `${authorName}`: Author name
- `${authorEmail}`: Author email
- `${authorDate}`: Author date
- `${authorDateAgo}`: Time difference between now and the author date
- `${branch}`: Commit source branch

sourceTracker.display.snapshotTemplate.markdownDescription:
Template for snapshot display in menus. **Supported variables:**

- `${message}`: Snapshot message
- `${snapshotDate}`: Snapshot creation date
- `${snapshotDateAgo}`: Time difference between now and snapshot creation

**Commit variables** (git commit state at snapshot creation):
- `${commitHash}`: Commit hash
- `${commitHashShort}`: Short commit hash
- `${commitSubject}`: First line of the commit message
- `${commitAuthorName}`: Author name
- `${commitAuthorEmail}`: Author email
- `${commitAuthorDate}`: Author date
- `${commitAuthorDateAgo}`: Time difference for commit date
- `${commitBranch}`: Source branch

enumDescriptions: Store snapshots in a `.vscode/snapshots` folder at the root of the workspace.
Store snapshots in the workspace storage location (vscode internal).
Store and access all snapshots globally (across all workspaces, stored in the extension's global storage).
sourceTracker.snapshots.storage.markdownDescription:
Choose where to store snapshots:
- **folder**: in `.vscode/snapshots` at the project root

sourceTracker.snapshots.triggers.markdownDescription: Configure when automatic snapshots should be created.

enumDescriptions: Do not create snapshots on open
Create snapshots on open
Create snapshot and activate it on open
Create snapshot and activate it if none active
Do not create snapshots on save
Create snapshots on save
Create snapshot and activate it on save
Create snapshot and activate it if none active

onDoubleSave.description: Create snapshot on double save (two saves in quick succession)
enumDescriptions: Do not create snapshots on double save
Create snapshots on double save
Create snapshot and activate it on double save
Create snapshot and activate it if none active

beforeApply.description: Create snapshot before applying (reverting to) a previous snapshot
enumDescriptions: Do not create snapshots before applying
Create snapshots before applying
Create snapshot and activate it when applying
Create snapshot and activate it if none active
Do not create snapshots before pasting
Create snapshots before pasting
Create snapshot and activate it before pasting
Create snapshot and activate it if none active

beforeDeletion.description: Create snapshot before large deletions (see deletionThreshold)
enumDescriptions: Do not create snapshots before deletion
Create snapshots before deletion
Create snapshot and activate it before deletion

sourceTracker.snapshots.doubleSaveDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds for double save detection

sourceTracker.snapshots.deletionThreshol.description: Number of lines that must be deleted to trigger a 'beforeDeletion' snapshot

sourceTracker.snapshots.maxAutoSnapshots.description: Maximum number of auto-generated snapshots per file (0 = unlimited)

sourceTracker.snapshots.maxAutoSnapshotS.description: Controls the maximum size of a file (in KB) allowed for auto triggered snapshots.

sourceTracker.snapshots.triggersExclude.markdownDescription: Configure [glob patterns](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) for excluding files and folders from automatic snapshot triggers
sourceTracker.snapshots.triggersExclude.description: File glob patterns to ignore for snapshot triggers
